    Donating to a wildlife conservation organization is a practical and effective way to support the protection of endangered species. It provides financial resources to organizations that work on conservation efforts, research, and habitat preservation. This option has a broader impact and supports long-term conservation goals.
    Doing nothing does not contribute to the protection of endangered species and does not address the issue at hand.
    Buying products made from endangered species contributes to the demand for these products, which can further endanger the species. This option actively harms the conservation efforts and should be avoided.
